Research difficulties: A writer may have difficulty finding reliable sources or may struggle to incorporate research into their writing in a clear and concise manner.
Time management: Writing a book can be a time-consuming process, and a writer may struggle to manage their time effectively, leading to delays and a loss of motivation.
Outlining and structure: A writer may struggle to develop a clear outline or structure for their book, which can make it difficult to organize their thoughts and ideas.
Editing and proofreading: A writer may struggle to edit and proofread their work, leading to errors and inconsistencies in the book.
Criticism and rejection: A writer may receive criticism or rejection from publishers or readers, which can be demotivating and lead to a loss of confidence in their work.
